alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 10:09AM EDT until March 28 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Washington County in north central Maryland... Northwestern Frederick County in north central Maryland... Northeastern Jefferson County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... Northeastern Morgan County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... Northeastern Berkeley County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... * Until 1045 AM EDT. * At 1008 AM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Saint James, or near Municipal Stadium, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Hagerstown, Municipal Stadium, Robinwood, Fountainhead-Orchard Hills, Boonsboro, Smithsburg, Paramount-Long Meadow, Wilson-Conococheague, Williamsport, Mount Aetna, Mount Lena, San Mar, Wolfsville, Saint James, Halfway, Maugansville, Myersville, Cavetown, Keedysville and Funkstown. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
